body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17304](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17304.html) (refactor: Move many functions into LegacyScriptPubKeyMan and further separate it from CWallet by achow101)
* [#17261](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17261.html) (Make ScriptPubKeyMan an actual interface and the wallet to have multiple by achow101)
* [#16895](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16895.html) (External signer multisig support by Sjors)
* [#16549](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16549.html) ([WIP] UI external signer support (e.g. hardware wallet) by Sjors)
* [#16546](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16546.html) ([WIP] External signer support - Wallet Box edition by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Question: Would it make sense for the `labels_value` method to indicate that it is only for the single member `labels` case (since `getaddressinfo` may support multiple labels in the future)?
diff_hunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,11 @@ def get_multisig(node):
                     p2sh_p2wsh_script=CScript([OP_HASH160, witness_script, OP_EQUAL]).hex(),
                     p2sh_p2wsh_addr=script_to_p2sh_p2wsh(script_code))
 
+def labels_value(name="", purpose="receive"):

body: Thanks @jachiang. I thought I'd update it if/when adding support for multiple labels, though happy to take a good suggestion now for a better name or docstring.
diff_hunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,11 @@ def get_multisig(node):
                     p2sh_p2wsh_script=CScript([OP_HASH160, witness_script, OP_EQUAL]).hex(),
                     p2sh_p2wsh_addr=script_to_p2sh_p2wsh(script_code))
 
+def labels_value(name="", purpose="receive"):

body: You're right, a docstring or inline comment would have probably sufficient for sb who is just looking at the functional test, and not the rpc code (where labels vector is actually documented). Happy to wait and see what other reviewers think :)

+def labels_value(name="", purpose="receive"):

body: The rpc code doc seems good, but explaining it in the help might be a good idea. Thanks, might update that. Thanks for the review!

body: <!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
There seems to be just some white space formatting in the commit on the following lines. Since they are changed in the next commit again I would combine these commits.
Would combine this commit with bb87d8aac71dc87d1f11c26bd97fa6dc7b650a75, as you are mostly touching LoC that you touched in the that one as well.
diff_hunk:
@@ -47,9 +50,6 @@ def check_fee_amount(self, curr_balance, balance_with_fee, fee_per_byte, tx_size
     def get_vsize(self, txn):
         return self.nodes[0].decoderawtransaction(txn)['vsize']
 
-    def labels_value(self, name="", purpose="receive"):

body: I think this one is touching the same lines as 3dcf1481cefae6ff2d585181578004045c3e3a1c, so I would combine these commits as well.
diff_hunk:
@@ -119,10 +119,12 @@ def run_test(self):
         # ScriptPubKey + internal + label
         self.log.info("Should not allow a label to be specified when internal is true")
         key = get_key(self.nodes[0])
+        label = "Unsuccessful labelling for internal addresses"

body: Yes, the first commit is limited to formatting fixes only, to keep it separate from the content fixes, and the specific label/labels content changes. It was more work to keep them separate but should be clearer for reviewing and in case of requested edits or dropping any unwanted commits. I named the commits accordingly.
Updated the code doc and help with more details.
diff_hunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,11 @@ def get_multisig(node):
                     p2sh_p2wsh_script=CScript([OP_HASH160, witness_script, OP_EQUAL]).hex(),
                     p2sh_p2wsh_addr=script_to_p2sh_p2wsh(script_code))
 
+def labels_value(name="", purpose="receive"):

body: I made a conscious effort to keep the logical changes separate, in case any changes were not wanted, for example if extracting this function to wallet_util.py was seen as unneeded abstraction.

-    def labels_value(self, name="", purpose="receive"):

body: The main change of this commit is extending testing of the getaddressinfo `labels` response to the `test_importmulti` functions. I can try to move the renamings to the previous commit.

body:
Updated the gist of the CLI help output after this PR (same urls as before):
[`bitcoin-cli help getaddressinfo` before this PR](https://gist.github.com/jonatack/022af5221a85c069780359a22643c810)
[`bitcoin-cli help getaddressinfo` after this PR](https://gist.github.com/jonatack/4ee5f6abc62a3d99269570206a5f90ba)

@fjahr I squashed the 4 commits adding RPC getaddressinfo "labels" test coverage and improving the existing "label" tests down to a single commit at e123923e630c051f676501aab9454ecbf3bd3956. Can you please re-ACK?
diff_hunk:

         # ScriptPubKey + internal + label
         self.log.info("Should not allow a label to be specified when internal is true")
         key = get_key(self.nodes[0])
+        label = "Unsuccessful labelling for internal addresses"

body: Code review ACK e123923e630c051f676501aab9454ecbf3bd3956
Not sure about this, but deprecation shouldn't be spread among multiples version (instead of multiple PRs inside same version) ?
diff_hunk:
@@ -3709,15 +3709,17 @@ UniValue getaddressinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "                                                         getaddressinfo output fields for the embedded address, excluding metadata (timestamp, hdkeypath,\n"
             "                                                         hdseedid) and relation to the wallet (ismine, iswatchonly).\n"
             "  \"iscompressed\" : true|false,        (boolean, optional) If the pubkey is compressed.\n"
-            "  \"label\" :  \"label\"                  (string) The label associated with the address. Defaults to \"\".\n"
+            "  \"label\" :  \"label\"                  (string) The label associated with the address. Defaults to \"\". Equivalent to the name field in the labels array\n"
+            "                                               below. This label field may be deprecated in the future; prefer consuming the labels array below instead.\n"

body: Yes. This is merely a recommandation in the help as a helpful guide for application developers confused whether to use `label` and `labels`.

body:
Code review ACK e123923e630c051f676501aab9454ecbf3bd3956

I find the clarification on `Label` vs. `Labels` in comments/help and the newly added test coverage of `Labels` helpful for anybody interfacing with `getaddressinfo`. Use `Labels` :)
